(9+ hours) depart early in the morning.  Get a seat near the front as part of the road is unpaved.

Minibuses to

leave throughout the day.  To Lindi and Mtwara the road is paved.

for transport heading further inland ask around at the bus stand.

Towards Tunduru there is a new modern road as far as the village of Mangaka but the next section is not yet built. If you want to see the Unity Bridge which goes over the Ruvuma River to Mozambique there is a well made murram (or laterite dirt) road towards the bridge from Mangaka.
According to some guide books there is a rock art site within walking distance of Masasi although I am yet to meet anyone who has found it.
There are a few small hills around Masasi and it is possible to hike up them.
There are no tourist guest houses but the town is a major centre in the cashew nut trade so there are a large number of guest houses in the TZS4,000-30,000 range.  You will get what you pay for.
